required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of Cetuximab Plus Irinotecan in Patients With EGFR-detectable Metastatic Colorectal Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Open Label, Non-randomized, Phase II Study to Assess the Activity and Safety of Cetuximab Plus Irinotecan in Subjects With EGFR-detectable Metastatic Colorectal Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the response rate of cetuximab plus irinotecan combination therapy in subjects with EGFR-detectable metastatic colorectal carcinoma who have documented progressive disease to irinotecan-based chemotherapy and who have failed (progressive disease or intolerance) previous oxaliplatin-based and fluoropyrimidine-based chemotherapies.

primary_outcome.measure: Response according to the RECIST criteria accessed every 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to progression, duration of achieved response, and the disease control rate will be accessed in all patients who received Cetuximab. The worst toxicity grades per patients will be tabulated for adverse events and laboratory measurements.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subject must have surgically unresectable metastatic colorectal carcinoma.
- The subjects who have received and failed Ilinotecan, oxaliplatin and fluoropyrimidine-based chemotherapy
- ECOG PS 0-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with symptomatic cerebral metastasis

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

results_reference.citation: Tahara M, Shirao K, Boku N, Yamaguchi K, Komatsu Y, Inaba Y, Arai T, Mizunuma N, Satoh T, Takiuchi H, Nishina T, Sakata Y. Multicenter Phase II study of cetuximab plus irinotecan in metastatic colorectal carcinoma refractory to irinotecan, oxaliplatin and fluoropyrimidines. Jpn J Clin Oncol. 2008 Nov;38(11):762-9. doi: 10.1093/jjco/hyn102. Epub 2008 Oct 4.

clinical_study.keyword: EGFR-detectable metastatic colorectal carcinoma with documented progressive disease to irinotecan-based chemotherapy and failure
